election_record.label: Massachusetts 1802 House of Representatives, Lancaster

overview.note: "A letter from Lancaster, of the 4th inst. says,'Mr. STEDMAN had 99 votes--Gen. WHITING 32, The jacobins calculated to have a large majority in favor of the General; But you may now see the good effects of the Attorney-General's dabbling in politics, and craming us with his doctrines,--Federalism is increasing.--Mr. S. is an uniform federalist--a gentleman of eminence in his profession, and who will do honor to his constituents.'" Columbian Centinel. Massachusetts Federalist (Boston, MA). May 8, 1802.

election_record.reference: Columbian Centinel. Massachusetts Federalist (Boston, MA). May 8, 1802.
